replication_study.hypothesis: Specify the focal hypothesis from the original paper and operationalize it with variables present in the provided replication dataset.

data_plan.source_type: Secondary dataset extracted for replication (RDS format).
data_plan.wave_or_subset: Not specified; uses the final compiled dataset in replication_data.
data_plan.sample_size: To be determined after loading the dataset in Python.
data_plan.unit_of_analysis: As per the original design; will verify once variables are inspected in the dataset.
data_plan.access_details: Dataset is provided locally under /app/data (to be mounted from data/original/11/0112_python_gpt5/replication_data). No external access required.

qualification.explanation: This dataset is provided explicitly for replication, packaged as an RDS and paired with original replication attempt R code. It is intended to reproduce the focal claim under similar variable definitions and modeling choices.
qualification.similarity_to_original: The dataset and analysis code align with the original paper’s operationalization per post_registration.json and original_paper.pdf; variable naming and modeling will be validated against these sources.
qualification.deviation_from_original: Exact deviations (e.g., sample windows, filters) will be identified once the dataset columns and R code filters are reviewed; this RDS represents an independent compilation from the original data sources and thus constitutes a distinct sample suitable for robustness testing.

data_plan.notes: We will translate the provided R code into Python and read the RDS via pyreadr. All IO will use /app/data. We will validate that the dataset contains all variables required by the focal model.

planned_method.steps: 1) Load the RDS dataset from /app/data via pyreadr. 2) Inspect columns and data types; confirm availability of outcome, treatment, and controls per the R code and post_registration.json. 3) Reproduce data cleaning/filters from the R script in Python. 4) Construct variables (including transformations or interactions) as in the original analysis. 5) Fit the specified model(s) using statsmodels (or linearmodels if panel/IV). 6) Save regression tables and diagnostics to /app/data. 7) Compare coefficients, standard errors, and significance with the original results.
planned_method.models: Replicate the model structure used in the R code; likely linear regression with controls (potentially fixed effects) as per post_registration.json. Exact specification will mirror the R script.
planned_method.outcome_variable: To be confirmed from the R code and dataset columns.
planned_method.independent_variables: Primary treatment(s) as defined in the R code; include transforms (e.g., log, squared) if present.
planned_method.control_variables: As listed in the R code and post_registration.json (fixed effects, time controls, covariates).
planned_method.tools_software: Python 3.10+ with pandas, numpy, pyreadr, statsmodels; optionally linearmodels for panel/fixed effects; seaborn/matplotlib for plots.

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Regression coefficients of the focal independent variable(s) on the outcome.
planned_estimation_and_test.test: t-tests on coefficients; robust/clustered SEs consistent with original specification.

planned_method.missing_data_handling: Listwise deletion by default; replicate R code’s NA handling (e.g., drop NAs before model).
planned_method.multiple_testing_policy: Not applicable unless multiple outcomes; if present, note in analysis and consider BH correction.
planned_method.inference_criteria: Two-sided tests at alpha=0.05 unless original specifies otherwise; direction and magnitude compared to original.

files.replication_rewrite__py.py: Python translation of 'Replication attempt code (FINAL).R'. It loads /app/data/Final replication dataset.rds with pyreadr, reproduces data preparation, constructs variables, runs the specified regression(s) using statsmodels, and writes outputs (CSV tables/figures) to /app/data.

codebase.notes: All paths hard-coded to /app/data. Non-Python code is not executed; the R script is used as a specification document. The Python rewrite preserves model specification, variable construction, and seed-dependent behavior when applicable.

analysis.instructions: 1) Ensure ./data is mounted to /app/data. 2) Place 'Final replication dataset.rds' into /app/data. 3) Run: python replication_rewrite__py.py. 4) Inspect outputs in /app/data (regression tables, logs).
analysis.comparison_metrics: Compare the focal coefficient(s) sign, magnitude, and statistical significance to the original estimates from post_registration.json and reported in the original_paper.pdf. Report percent deviation in magnitude, confidence interval overlap, and sign consistency.
